description.narrative: Communities need to be aware of the possible hazards and risk that surround them to be resilient and in a position to make evidence-based decisions that can reduce the impact of natural hazards. This fundamental information provides the foundation for effective response to a given disaster event, thus allowing communities to recover quickly and effectively, and ideally enabling them to better position themselves post-disaster. The objective of this program is to support the Government of Papua New Guinea (GoPNG) in developing fundamental information and practices for the effective response and management of natural hazards. The program places a focus on the ‘down-stream’ users of this technical information within Papua New Guinea (PNG), with an emphasis on establishing which products are needed by decision-makers to best support their activities and then determining the most appropriate technical outputs to use as the evidence-base and the most appropriate pathways to their use. Succes
